efactoring tool operates on an AST. Nodes on the AST have

he refactoring tool should take into consideration.


No, the AST can't hel=
p you there because it has zero type information.

Consider this example:

=
def f(o)
  o.init()
end

def g(o)
  o.init()
end

You rename init to init2,=
 how can the IDE know which ones needs to be
renamed?

It can't.  Nobody ca=
n.

It's one of the reasons why Duck Typing is
dangerous<http://www.beust.c=
om/weblog/archives/000269.html>
.
